metadata.Title: CVE-2022-33743 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
network backend may cause Linux netfront to use freed SKBs While addinglogic to support XDP (eXpress Data Path), a code label was moved in a wayallowing for SKBs having references (pointers) retained for furtherprocessing to nevertheless be freed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-33743` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1083-fips - 4.4.0-1083.90
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1083-fips - 4.4.0-1083.90
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1083-fips - 4.4.0-1083.90
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1083-fips - 4.4.0-1083.90
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
